solution_line_template: Chris would earn {asking_price} - {asking_price} / {maintenance_inspection_divisor} = {asking_price} - {maintenance_inspection_cost} = ${<<{asking_price}-{asking_price}/{maintenance_inspection_divisor}={earnings_first_buyer}>>}{earnings_first_buyer} from the first buyer.

He would earn {asking_price} - {headlight_cost} - {headlight_cost} * {tire_cost_multiplier} = {asking_price} - {headlight_cost} * {total_multiplier} = {asking_price} - {total_repair_cost} = ${<<{asking_price}-{headlight_cost}-{headlight_cost}*{tire_cost_multiplier}={earnings_second_buyer}>>}{earnings_second_buyer} from the second buyer.

The difference between Chris's earnings would be {earnings_second_buyer} - {earnings_first_buyer} = ${<<{earnings_second_buyer}-{earnings_first_buyer}={difference_in_earnings}>>}{difference_in_earnings}.
